references.paper_title: Towards deep learning models resistant to adversarial attacks
references.reason: This paper is foundational in the field of adversarial machine learning, introducing the concept and methodology for creating adversarial examples against deep learning models, which the current paper builds upon to develop novel attack methods for tabular data.

This paper provides a comprehensive analysis of different adversarial attack methods and their limitations, which is crucial for evaluating and comparing the performance of the novel attacks presented in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Evading classifiers in discrete domains with provable optimality guarantees
references.reason: This paper introduces the Multi-Objective Evolutionary Adversarial Attack (MOEVA), which is a key component of the proposed CAA, demonstrating a search-based approach for adversarial attacks and providing strong baseline for performance comparison.

references.paper_title: A Unified Framework for Adversarial Attack and Defense in Constrained Feature Space
references.reason: This paper, by the same authors, is directly related to the current work, introducing the foundational work on constrained adversarial attacks against tabular data and establishing a baseline for comparison.

references.paper_title: Deep Neural Networks and Tabular Data: A Survey
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of deep learning models for tabular data, helping to contextualize the current research by summarizing existing architectures and highlighting the need for improved robustness in this area.
